channel.title: Crypto News - SosoValue Research
channel.description: Latest crypto news from SosoValue Research

item.title:
Sui Announces Integration with NEAR Intents, Introducing Ultra-Fast Cross-Chain Swaps to the EcosystemOn July 21st, Sui announced its integration with NEAR Intents. NEAR Intents is built on the NEAR blockchain. This integration allows Sui users to bypass traditional complex smart contract processes. Instead, they only need to express their intent, and the request will be automatically routed by "solvers" who will select the optimal execution path. This enables seamless interaction with 20 chains and over 80 assets, providing an extremely fast and simple cross-chain exchange experience. Currently, users can directly exchange assets from other chains such as NEAR, BTC, ETH, SOL, XRP, DOGE, ZEC into the Sui ecosystem without relying on bridging or intermediate tools.
The integration is now officially live and available. Developers can now directly integrate NEAR Intents into Sui applications to enhance functionality and expand user reach. In the coming weeks, more Sui native assets will be supported, further expanding its application value.
The integration of Sui with NEAR Intents will enhance Sui's ecosystem interoperability and further build a flywheel for ecosystem growth, especially at this critical juncture of rapid Sui DeFi development. To date, Sui TVL has exceeded $2.2 billion, ranking 8th among all blockchains. In the past 30 days, Sui DEX trading volume exceeded $8.1 billion, ranking 8th. Meanwhile, the market cap of Sui stablecoins exceeded $1 billion in June, an increase of over 180% since the beginning of the year. [TechFlow]

item.title: JPMorgan Chase data-charging plan could "destroy" crypto and fintech startups, executive warnsOn July 21, according to Fortune magazine, last month, when JPMorgan Chase informed fintech companies that it planned to charge them for accessing its customers' bank account data, the move caused a strong reaction in many areas of the financial industry. According to four industry executives, the move is a blow to the fintech industry and may have a devastating impact on early startups, including those in the cryptocurrency industry. However, analysts believe that mature fintech companies such as PayPal and Block (formerly Square) may not be greatly affected by this fee adjustment. Under the plan, the bank could charge data aggregators fees every time a consumer moves money from JPMorgan to a cryptocurrency account or a third-party service like Robinhood. Crypto and fintech companies often use aggregators like Plaid or MX to access customer accounts at major financial institutions like JPMorgan. So far, banks haven’t charged fintech companies, but that could change. Aggregators are widely expected to pass on the new fees to fintech customers, and some may even pass the costs on to consumers. [PANews]

item.title: A whale transferred 400 BTC to Binance, realizing a profit of over $100 million, and still holds a position of over $128 million.According to Onchain Lens monitoring, a whale transferred 400.1 Bitcoin (worth approximately $47.23 million) to Binance, realizing a profit of approximately $107.08 million. The whale initially withdrew 1,500 Bitcoin from Binance 8 to 9 months ago (worth approximately $69.01 million at the time), and currently still holds 1,100 Bitcoin, worth approximately $128.87 million. [Wu Blockchain]

item.title: Ethereum will pass The Torch NFT to commemorate its tenth anniversary and will open up commemorative NFT minting to everyone.Ethereum has launched The Torch NFT, designed to commemorate the people and values that shaped Ethereum's first decade and will help build its future. In the 10 days leading up to Ethereum's tenth anniversary, the NFT will be symbolically passed between wallets. On July 30th, the NFT will be burned to commemorate the tenth anniversary of Ethereum's founding. In addition, everyone can mint a commemorative NFT. [Foresight News]

item.title: Bitdeer mined 65 BTC last week, with total Bitcoin holdings exceeding 1,600Nasdaq-listed Bitcoin mining company Bitdeer announced the latest data on its Bitcoin holdings on the X platform. As of July 18, its total Bitcoin holdings have increased to 1,601.4 coins (note: this amount is pure holdings and does not include Bitcoin deposited by customers). In addition, its Bitcoin mining output last week was 65.0 BTC, but it sold 27.4 BTC. [Odaily Planet Daily]

item.title: Huajian Medical establishes a wholly-owned subsidiary in the United States and initiates application for a U.S. stablecoin licenseOn July 21, according to Zhitong Finance, the Hong Kong-listed company Huajian Medical announced that it has established a wholly-owned subsidiary, IVD GROUP, in New York State. The US subsidiary will promote the core operating entity of the IVDNewCo Exchange strategy in the United States. In addition, the US subsidiary has officially started the process of submitting a stablecoin license application to relevant US regulatory agencies (including but not limited to the SEC and CFTC). This move is a substantial advancement of the group's "US stablecoin license application plan" in the previous announcement, demonstrating the group's execution and foresight in its global compliance layout. [PANews]

item.title: Vitalik: 50% of stakers support raising the Ethereum L1 Gas limit to 45.00 millionEthereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin tweeted that almost exactly 50% of staking votes supported raising the L1 gas limit to 45.000 million. The gas limit has now begun to increase and has now reached 37.300 million. [Wu Blockchain]

item.title: IOST announces the establishment of the I Foundation to focus on RWA project investmentOn July 21, IOST announced the establishment of the I Foundation, which will focus on investing in promising RWA projects in the L1 and BNB Chain ecosystems. item.title: Bithumb plans to suspend deposits and withdrawals of MultiverseX (EGLD) on July 24.According to the official announcement, Bithumb has announced its cooperation with the MultiverseX (EGLD) network (mainnet) upgrade, and plans to suspend MultiverseX (EGLD) deposits and withdrawals at 6:00 PM (Korean Standard Time) on Thursday, July 24, 2025. Deposit and withdrawal services will be restored as soon as possible after the network is stable. [Odaily Planet Daily]

item.title: Jack Dorsey's Block to Be Added to S&P 500 Index on July 23According to The Block, Block (stock ticker: XYZ), the payment platform founded by Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey, will be added to the S&P 500 index on July 23. Block will replace Hess Corporation, which is leaving the index after being acquired by Chevron. After the news was confirmed late Friday, the stock rose 10% in after-hours trading. [Foresight News]

item.title: CITIC Securities: The US Stablecoin Act has been implemented, and relaxed regulation is conducive to market expansionOn July 21, according to Zhitong Finance, the CITIC Securities Research Report stated that on July 17, Eastern Time, the U.S. Congress passed the GENIUS Act, marking the official implementation of the first federal-level stablecoin regulatory framework in the United States. From the perspective of the bill's advancement process, after the passage of the "Big and Beautiful Act", crypto legislation was quickly listed as the top agenda of the House of Representatives, and Trump personally promoted consensus within the Republican Party, highlighting the priority of the crypto field in the U.S. policy framework. From the content of the bill, the House of Representatives did not make substantive changes to the version passed by the Senate, and still retained a relatively loose regulatory framework with the federal government as the main body and the state level as the supplement. Looking ahead, as the regulatory details of the GENIUS Act are implemented, U.S. financial and technology giants are expected to accelerate their entry, promote the accelerated diffusion of stablecoins from issuance to application scenarios, and may bring about the continued expansion of the stablecoin market size. [PANews]
